checking.compile

Interface CompileChecker

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GccCompileChecker, HaskellCompileChecker, JavaCompileChecker

    public interface CompileChecker
    Interface which a compile checker must provide. A compile checker determines whether a submitted program compiles or not, by using a specified compiler on a set of submitted files.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToProgramFile, java.nio.file.Path outputFolder, java.lang.String compilerName, java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags) 
      CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToProgramFile, java.lang.String compilerName, java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags)
      Convenience Method to call without specifying an output folder.

    • Method Detail

      • checkProgram

        CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToProgramFile,
                          java.nio.file.Path outputFolder,
                          java.lang.String compilerName,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags)
                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   BadCompilerSpecifiedException,
                                   BadFlagException,
                                   CompilerOutputFolderExistsException
        Parameters:
        pathToProgramFile - The Path to a File that is to be compiled. Dependencies on other files are resolved automatically, if a valid package structure is found.
        outputFolder - The file compiler output is written to.
        compilerFlags - Additional flags to be passed to the compiler, each as a list item.
        compilerName - Name of the compiler that should be called. For example "javac" or "openjavac" if both oracle javac and openjdk are installed.
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating whether the program did compile (true) or not (false)
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - When the given sourcefile cannot be found.
        BadCompilerSpecifiedException - When the given compiler can't be located.
        BadFlagException - When javac doesn't recognize a flag, this exception is thrown.
        CompilerOutputFolderExistsException - When the given output folder already exists. We require it to not exist, since we might stomp on important files otherwise.

      • checkProgram

        CompilerOutput checkProgram(java.nio.file.Path pathToProgramFile,
                          java.lang.String compilerName,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> compilerFlags)
                            throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                   BadCompilerSpecifiedException,
                                   BadFlagException
        Convenience Method to call without specifying an output folder. .class files are placed in sourceFolder.
        Parameters:
        pathToProgramFile - See other method.
        compilerName - See other method.
        compilerFlags - See other method.
        Returns:
        See other method.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - See other method.
        BadCompilerSpecifiedException - See other method.
        BadFlagException - See other method.
